item.title: Pipeline challenge / Hexlet Learning Guide
item.goal: Create a client that implements message transmission to a similar client via a noisy channel using any programming language.
item.author: Kirill Mokevnin

item.title: HTTP basics / Hexlet Learning Guide
item.goal: Learn how http requests work and how server processes them, what happens after you type the address in the browser; what client-server is, how http-session looks like and how to debug it.
item.author: Rakhim Davletkaliyev

item.title: Sample lesson / Hexlet Learning Guide
item.goal: Show users and authors the possibilities of Hexlet platform
item.author: Rakhim Davletkaliyev

item.title: Pure functions and side effects / Intro to Programming
item.goal: Explore the idea of determinism, side effects, and purity in functions. Get to know the beauty of pure functions.
item.author: Rakhim Davletkaliyev

item.title: Typing: dynamic vs. static and weak vs strong / Intro to Programming
item.goal: Learn about types in JavaScript, and understand the difference between dynamic and static typing and weak and strong typing.
item.author: Rakhim Davletkaliyev

item.title: Environment, scope and closures / Intro to Programming
item.goal: Understand how and why isolated environments are created in JS, what scoping is and how cool are closures.
item.author: Rakhim Davletkaliyev

item.title: Expressions vs. Statements / Intro to Programming
item.goal: Understand the important distinction: expressions vs. statements in JavaScript. And learn how this knowledge will help you.
item.author: Rakhim Davletkaliyev

item.title: Dividing code into modules / Intro to Programming
item.goal: Learn about dividing code into meaningful and reusable modules.
item.author: Rakhim Davletkaliyev

item.title: Testing code with other code / Intro to Programming
item.goal: Understand the idea of testing code — writing code that checks the behavior of other code, look at some examples and write your own tests
item.author: Rakhim Davletkaliyev

item.title: Mutators and for loop / Intro to Programming
item.goal: Learn some arithmetic shortcuts to quickly change the values of variables, and get to know the for loop — another way to create repeating code.
item.author: Rakhim Davletkaliyev
